div.div:
If you are experiencing fever, cough or shortness of breath, call your healthcare provider. Do not visit your doctors office or an emergency room without calling first so staff members can take appropriate precautions. If you do not have a health care provider, contact the Monroe County Department of Public Healths COVID-19 hotline or email:
PHONE: (585) 753-5555
EMAIL:COVID19@monroecounty.gov
div.p: Dear Parents/Guardians:

Governor Cuomo announced, as part of his executive order, that school districts across New York State must continue instruction during spring break. AlthoughI dont wholeheartedly agree with the decision, we must comply as a district. Our teachers will continue to provide assignments and communicate with students during this time. That said, the Hilton School District will take a common-sense approach to this directive with the understanding that families are already stressed and doing the best they can to balance many responsibilities.

The district will continue to provide free student breakfasts and lunches from April 6-9. The times and locations are listed on the district website. In addition, I encourage you to visit our Social-Emotional Resources webpage at Hilton.k12.ny.us/SOMO where you will find resources and support to help you and your family cope during these difficult times.
It continues to be important to stay home even if you feel healthy because the virus can be spread without symptoms. If you must go outside, please be responsible and practice social distancing.
Please stay safe and well.

Sincerely,
Casey Kosiorek, Ed.D.
Superintendent of Schools
Dear Hilton Learning Community:

Thank you for your efforts as we end this second week of operating remotely as a school District. I hope that todays message finds you and your family safe and healthy. I know that many of you are stressed and this crisis is impacting people at different levels. If everyone does their best with what they have, we will come through this even stronger as a learning community. We would love to hear about your to positive stories and see photos of home instruction. Please submit them to communications@hiltonl.k12.ny.us.

Governor Cuomo announced today that schools across the state will be closed until April 15. Our staff will continue to provide many resources for you during the closure. Be sure to check out both the Home Learning and COVID-19 sections of our website. Quick links are located on the left of the home page.

Starting on Monday, March 30, a social emotional helpline will be active from 9 a.m. to 3 p.m. Monday through Friday. Parents or students can call the helpline number to speak with a live person for resources and tips to support their well-being during this difficult time. Please visit the Social Emotional Resources page on the Districts Home Learning Information page to learn more about the helpline and access the phone number.

Our Food Service staff has provided over 8,000 meals to students since the closure. I encourage you to check the website for updated distribution times for some of the sites beginning Monday and to take advantage of this opportunity to provide your child with free, nutritious breakfasts and lunches during the closure.

At this point, our Technology Dept. is no longer able to provide Chromebooks and chargers. If your child is experiencing technical issues or has questions about technology, please contact your childs teacher. If the teacher is not able to answer the question, they will have a technician contact you. The Technology Dept. has also added several helpful resources to its webpage under the COVID-19 section.
Please remember that all district buildings and facilities are closed until further notice. If you call the school, someone will return your call as soon as possible.
Every Student. Everywhere. Every Day.

Sincerely,
Casey Kosiorek, Ed.D.
Superintendent of Schools
Dear Hilton Learning Community:
I hope your family is safe and healthy. The following letter outlines the progress the district is making as we move forward with remote operations.

First, I would like to thank you for your patience during this unprecedented time in our lives. Many of you are working from home or not able to work at all while balancing the many demands of keeping your family healthy, childcare, at-home teaching and finding enriching activities for your family while at home.

Please know that our staff is working to provide many resources for you. Be sure to check out the Home Learning section of our website regularly. You should be receiving more information from your childs teachers soon if you havent already. Please contact your childs teacher or principal if you have any questions regarding your children(s) school work. As we learn more about the duration of this closure, we will do our best to provide meaningful learning opportunities.

We have been able to provide healthy meals for families at several locations throughout the community. Again, please check the district website for a complete list of distribution locations and hours. Links to community resources are also available on our COVID-19 webpage.

I recognize that this is a stressful time for everyone. Please know that our mental health staff (counselors, psychologists, and social workers) will be providing resources for all families via the district website and Google Classroom. A social-emotional helpline is being established to provide phone support and resources to any family that needs it.

We understand that the technology issues some of you are facing are frustrating. If your child is experiencing technical issues or has questions about technology, please contact your childs teacher. If the teacher is not able to answer the question, they will have a technician contact you. Unfortunately, at this time we do not have a safe way to assist with the repairs of devices, but many new devices were distributed to families in need this afternoon. If you need internet accessibility, please check out the free resources listed on our website.

All district buildings and facilities are closed until further notice. If you call the school, someone will return your call as soon as possible as staff voicemail is now linked to email. Our school leaders will continue to update our website and check emails throughout this crisis, and together we will get through it. There is no one size fits all approach to what we are experiencing, but what is common to us all is that we want what is best for our children. Hilton is a resilient community.
Please look for updates every Friday. Enjoy the weekend and take care.

Sincerely,
Casey Kosiorek, Ed.D.
Superintendent of Schools
All Monroe County PublicSchools will be closed to studentsbeginningMonday, March 16 until furthernotice.
Staff may be asked to reportdepending on individual district needs. At Hilton, staff should not report at this time.
This closing includes allschool-related activities including sports and otherextracurricularactivities.

The Hilton School Districtwill share more specific information regarding their plans for food,social supports, home learning activitiesand other operationalprocedures with our community. Please check your email and the district website regularly.
The Monroe County HealthDepartment and school leaders will be reviewing this on a week to week basis and providing an update by midday Friday.
Dear Hilton Learning Community:

As you may be aware, the second COVID-19 casewas confirmed by CountyExecutive Adam Bello and Health Commissioner Dr.Michael Mendozathis morning. Please anticipate further correspondence as itrelates to our schooldistrict later today. Iwant to thank our schoolcommunity for the supportand words of encouragement as we work through thistogether.

Sincerely,
Casey Kosiorek, Ed.D.
Superintendent of Schools
Dear Hilton Learning Community:

Thank you for your patience as we navigate through this unprecedented situation with COVID-19. Schools closing has moved to the forefront of the community conversation, so I wanted to communicate with you information on how that decision is made. Based on the guidance we have been given, a school will close for the following reasons:

ol.li: There is a confirmed case of COVID-19 found in a school.

There is a confirmed case of COVID-19 in the Hilton community of unknown origin or what is known as "community transmission." That means the transmission of the COVID-19 cannot be traced back to a particular global region of concern or person.

div.p: Governor Cuomo is directing any school with a confirmed COVID-19 case to close for at least 24 hours so it can undergo deep cleaning and sanitation. The school would then decide with local health officials on the duration of the closure.

A great deal of planning is taking place should Hilton Schools need to close, and our instructional leaders and staff are working to organize materials and resources. This situation is much different than a snow day because we do not know the duration of the closure. If schools are directed to close, every day leading up to that is a precious day of instruction. We cannot afford to lose this time.

We are asking that families make plans for childcare in the event of a closure. Also, please refer to our COVID-19 webpage for important updates and resources, including a link with information on free access to Spectrum broadband and Wi-Fi for 60 days. Visit Hilton.k12.ny.us/COVID.

Sincerely,
Casey Kosiorek, Ed.D.
Superintendent
Dear Hilton Learning Community:

I know that the Novel Coronavirus (COVID-19) is on everyones minds and the importance of receiving accurate, timely information is paramount. Monroe County School Districts are working together with the Monroe County Department of Public Health and the New York State Department of Health to ensure that we are doing everything we can to keep our schools healthy and our community informed.

Attached is a document that outlines the measures we are currently taking and the plan that is in place should there be additional COVID-19 cases in our area. Please take time to review this document and reiterate with your family members the importance of thorough and frequent hand washing, respiratory etiquette and staying home when ill.

p.strong: Hilton CSD will be following the Monroe County Health Departments recommendation on large group gatherings. Outside of the school day, all large gatherings will be canceled. This includes all field trips during the school day, in addition to all international travel until further notice.

div.p: We will continue to evaluate the situation and work closely with our colleagues throughout the county and state to come to the best decisions for the region and our own district with student and staff safety being our first priority. Please click on the graphic to the rightfor more information about what you can do and what the district is doing to keep our students and staff safe and healthy.
Anyone with questions or concerns about virus symptoms can call (585) 753-5555 or email COVID19@monroecounty.gov. I will continue to keep you informed as information becomes available.
Thank you and best wishes for continued good health.

Sincerely,
Casey Kosiorek, Ed.D.
Superintendent of Schools
DearHilton Learning Community:

TheNovel Coronavirus 2019 (COVID-19)continues to make headlines as news of cases in the United States and othercountries are reported. The HiltonCentral School District, in conjunction withthe Monroe CountyDepartment of Health, is monitoring this developingsituation.

TheCenters for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) is providing guidance ascommunities prepare for the possible spread of the disease. Symptoms ofthe COVID-19 include fever, cough and/or difficultybreathing. The same steps recommended for staying healthy during the annualcold and influenzaseason are also applicable during the outbreak of this newrespiratory virus:

ul.li: Wash your hands often with soap and water for at least 20 seconds.If soap and water are not available, use an alcohol-based hand sanitizer.
Avoid touching your eyes, nose and mouth with unwashed hands.
Avoid close contact with people who are sick.
Stay home when you are sick. Do not return to school until you are fever free for 24 hours without using fever-reducing medication.
Cover your cough or sneeze with a tissue, then throw the tissue in the trash.

div.p: Formore information about COVID-19 and cases in the United States, please visit:

a.title: Link to new page
Link to new page
Link to new page

div.p: Schools,working together with local health departments, have an important role inslowing the spread of diseases to help ensure students have safe andhealthylearning environments. We take this role seriously as the healthand safety ofour students and staff remains our top priority.
Ifyou have any questions, please contact your childs principal or StudentServices Specialist Liz Thornton at 392-1000, ext. 6055.

Sincerely,
Dr. Casey Kosiorek
Superintendent of Schools
